text: I choose to talk about the invention of “My heritage”. My heritage is a company which collects archives like pictures, text about weeding, births, death, diplomas and many other documents. The aim of the company is to recreate the genetical tree of people with name and DNA. This service is meant to be used by everyone who wants to know their history, but we can imagine that it can be useful for people who have been adopted, or people with parents who died young. So the company asks for a DNA test that they will analyze and also put in their database to see if it matches with someone’s DNA test. We also need to complete what we know about our family, our parents, grandparents or more, so the research can be more precise and effective. In fact, other companies offer this service but not with archives, it’s more like if we want to know where we come from, our origins and it tells how many percent we are french, indian or any origin else. But it also works with DNA tests. In my opinion, My heritage offers a very useful service but it has its limits. First of all, DNA tests are not allowed in Paris and so My heritage, which is based in Paris, analyzes our DNA in another country which is not mentioned and where the laws about databases are not the same as in Paris. Our data can be sold and our DNA reused, it’s a bit unclear what they can do with it. Second, people can be found although they don’t want to be, it’s why in Paris women can give birth “under X” and keep the anonyma. Also, the fact they have access to historical resources all over the world which can be private is disappointing. Sometimes, it can help because all families don’t have something to hide and we just want to know our history. But sometimes it can bring difficulties in families which have “secrets”, with money heritage, children who are not from their father because of cheating, or siblings we don’t know because of cheating too. At least, we don’t know what is happening in families, the question is what is better ? Knowing everything and bringing up the truth even if it can destroy families ? Or, live a comfortable life without knowing ?
